meanings.definition: A person who brags or boasts about their achievements or possessions.
meanings.sent1: The boaster at school always talked about how many trophies he had.
meanings.sent2: My uncle is a boaster who loves to show off his new car.
meanings.sent3: The boaster in the office claimed he could do the work of three people by himself.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the boaster of the family, always talking about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent5: The boaster's stories about his adventures were always larger than life.

meanings.definition: To speak with excessive pride or self-satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: He would boaster about his grades to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: She tends to boaster about her cooking skills whenever guests come over.
meanings.sent3: The little boy would boaster about how fast he could run, even though he always came last in races.
meanings.sent4: The politician continued to boaster about his accomplishments, even though many doubted their truth.
meanings.sent5: The singer would boaster about her upcoming concert, hoping to attract a larger audience.
